5 fun things this week

LCJ 6:39 a.m. EST November 12, 2014

Important schedule.(Photo: Getty Images/iStockphoto )

2 CONNECT 1 TWEETLINKEDINCOMMENTEMAILMORE

North American Championship Rodeo. Freedom Hall, Kentucky Exposition Center, 937 Phillips Lane, 7:30 p.m. Thursday-Saturday. $25 Thursday, $30 Friday, $32 Saturday; ages 11 and younger, $5 Thursday, $10 Friday and Saturday. Parking $8, $20 bus. (502) 367-5000.

International Women's a Cappella Convention and Contest. Galt House Hotel, 140 N. Fourth St., 7:30 p.m. Thursday; 11 a.m. Friday; 10:30 a.m. Saturday. Thursday, The Parade of Champions Show featuring current and past gold medal winners. Friday, quartet semi-finals (11 a.m.); the top 10 finalists will compete for gold medals and crowns (8 p.m.). Saturday, top qualifying choruses from the U.S. and Canada compete for the international chorus championship. Tickets available at the door. $20, $10 students for the Parade of Champions; $15, $8 students for contests and Championship Showcase. www.harmonyinc.org

Salute to the Legends Dinner. Muhammad Ali Center, 144 N. Sixth St., 6-9 p.m. Sunday. Features former University of Louisville and University of Kentucky athletes, dinner, drinks, raffle and a live auction of U of L and UK memorabilia autographed by coaches and players. Proceeds to benefit children and young adults who have been the victims of abuse, abandonment and neglect. Hosted by the Boys and Girls Haven and the Muhammad Ali Center. $75. salutetolegends.eventbrite.com

Floyd Memorial Hospital Auxiliary Masquerade $5 Jewelry and Accessories Sale. Classroom 3, 1850 State St., New Albany, 7 a.m.-5 p.m. Monday. Proceeds benefit Floyd Memorial Auxiliary Projects.

TAKE THE KIDS: Top fun things for families

BARS & CLUBS: 5 spots for live music

CONCERTS: Top shows to check out

ON STAGE: 5 productions now playing

23rd Annual Holiday Gift Show: Temptations. Olmsted, 3701 Frankfort Ave., 4-8 p.m. Tuesday; 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Nov. 19 and 20. Over 30 juried vendors with antiques, clothing, gifts, pillows, pottery, paper, photography, stationary, handbags, jewelry, food and more. The Multiple Sclerosis Society will host a penny social, purchase a ticket and place it in a jar in front of the item desired. Different items each day. Proceeds to benefit the National Multiple Sclerosis Society Kentucky/Southeast Indiana Chapter. Lunch is available on Nov. 19 and 20. Merchants list is available online. temptationsholidayboutique.com

And lots more stuff to do ...

Events

North American International Livestock Exposition. Kentucky Exposition Center, 937 Phillips Lane, Thursday through Nov. 21. $6, $3 seniors and ages 12 and younger. Parking, $8, $20 bus. For a complete schedule: www.livestockexpo.org/schedule.aspx.

North American Championship Rodeo. Freedom Hall, Kentucky Exposition Center, 937 Phillips Lane, 7:30 p.m. Thursday-Saturday. $25 Thursday, $30 Friday, $32 Saturday; ages 11 and younger, $5 Thursday, $10 Friday and Saturday. Parking $8, $20 bus. (502) 367-5000.

Anchal Project's Holiday Trunk Show. White Hall, 3110 Lexington Road, 4:30-8 p.m. Thursday. Meet Anchal's co-founder Colleen Clines, also shopping, hors d'oeuvres and libations. Anchal provides alternative careers in textiles to marginalized and exploited women living in India.

International Women's a Cappella Convention and Contest. Galt House Hotel, 140 N. Fourth St., 7:30 p.m. Thursday; 11 a.m. Friday; 10:30 a.m. Saturday. Thursday, The Parade of Champions Show featuring current and past gold medal winners. Friday, quartet semi-finals (11 a.m.); the top 10 finalists will compete for gold medals and crowns (8 p.m.). Saturday, top qualifying choruses from the U.S. and Canada compete for the international chorus championship. Tickets available at the door. $20, $10 students for the Parade of Champions; $15, $8 students for contests and Championship Showcase. www.harmonyinc.org.

2014 Festival of Trees and Lights. Louisville Slugger Field, 401 E. Main St., 10 a.m.-6 p.m. Friday-Sunday. Activities include Main Street on Ice skating rink, miniature train display, Sweet Shop packed with homemade delicacies, gift shop filled with holiday gifts and holiday design and displays. $8, $5 for ages 11 and younger and seniors. Friday, 6-9 p.m., Dickens Family Night. Dickens-era costumed characters and carolers, Santa Claus, free children's activities and a fireworks show. $8, $5 children, $25 for a family of four or more. kosairchildrenshospital.com/festivaloftreesandlights.

Spalding University's Festival of Contemporary Writing. Fall-spring reading series ill be held Saturday, Tuesday through Nov. 22, The Brown Hotel, 335 W. Broadway and Spalding's Egan Leadership Center, 901 S. Fourth St. The festival features readings by faculty, guests and alumni of Spalding University's low-residency Master of Fine Arts in Writing Program. A presentation by Pam Munoz Ryan, author and the Diana M. Raab Distinguished Writer in Residence, Nov. 19, 5:30 p.m., The Brown Hotel. Readings and events are free. For a complete schedule, spalding.edu/mfa; (502) 873-4400.

Run With Our Heroes 5K Run/Walk. University of Louisville, South Floyd Street across from the Lacrosse Stadium (site of old silos), 8 a.m. Saturday. Part of Mayor Greg Fischer's 2014 Week of Valor. Registration begins at 6:30 a.m. Registration fee, $40, $25 for active military or veterans, $10 for ages 12 and younger. runwithourheroes.org

Salute to the Legends Dinner. Muhammad Ali Center, 144 N. Sixth St., 6-9 p.m. Sunday. Features former University of Louisville and University of Kentucky athletes, dinner, drinks, raffle and a live auction of U of L and UK memorabilia autographed by coaches and players. Proceeds to benefit children and young adults who have been the victims of abuse, abandonment and neglect. Hosted by the Boys and Girls Haven and the Muhammad Ali Center. $75. salutetolegends.eventbrite.com

Floyd Memorial Hospital Auxiliary Masquerade $5 Jewelry and Accessories Sale. Classroom 3, 1850 State St., New Albany, 7 a.m.-5 p.m. Monday. Proceeds benefit Floyd Memorial Auxiliary Projects.

23rd Annual Holiday Gift Show: Temptations. Olmsted, 3701 Frankfort Ave., 4-8 p.m. Tuesday; 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Nov. 19 and 20. Over 30 juried vendors with antiques, clothing, gifts, pillows, pottery, paper, photography, stationary, handbags, jewelry, food and more. The Multiple Sclerosis Society will host a penny social, purchase a ticket and place it in a jar in front of the item desired. Different items each day. Proceeds to benefit the National Multiple Sclerosis Society Kentucky/Southeast Indiana Chapter. Lunch is available on Nov. 19 and 20. Merchants list is available online. temptationsholidayboutique.com

Spectator sports

University of Louisville Cardinals vs. University of Tennessee Martin. KFC Yum! Center, 1 Arena Plaza, 2 p.m. Sunday. Women's basketball. $10. (800) 745-3000.

University of Louisville Cardinals vs. Jacksonville State. KFC Yum! Center, 1 Arena Plaza, 7 p.m. Monday. Men's basketball. $41. (800) 745-3000.

Churchill Downs. 700 Central Ave., 12:40 p.m. Thursday, Saturday, Sunday and Nov. 19. Downs After Dark, 4:30 p.m. Friday. $3; $10 Friday, Casino Royale theme. (502) 636-4400.

Tastings

Wine & Whiskey Night. Westport Whiskey & Wine, 1115 Herr Lane, 6-8 p.m. Thursday. Emily Walz from Fetzer Vineyards will offer a selection of great values. Wines $3 by-the-glass, $2 whiskeys will be from non-traditional bourbon states, like Montana, Washington, Oregon and other states where we have found something new.

Light Up the Village Tasting. Westport Whiskey & Wine, 1115 Herr Lane, 6-9 p.m. Friday. Get an early start on holiday shopping as Westport Village will be all aglow. $2 beers and specials in the tasting room.

Dan Garrison of Texas' Garrison Brothers Distillery. Westport Whiskey & Wine, 1115 Herr Lane, 4-5 p.m. Sunday. Garrison will tell the story of how he developed the Garrison Brothers brands with the help of famous Kentucky master distillers. Serving light food to pair with his fine bourbons. $15, $10 for Tasting Club members. Reservations required, (502) 708-1313.

Holiday Wines with Rudy Basile of Vias Imports. Westport Whiskey & Wine, 1115 Herr Lane, 7 p.m. Nov. 19. This portfolio is noted for its Italian wine selections. DiFabio's Casapela Italian Restaurant will provide small plates to pair with the wines. $20, $15 for Tasting Club members. Reservations required, (502) 708-1313.

Film

Planetarium shows. Gheens Science Hall & Rauch Planetarium, 108 W. Brandeis Ave. $8, $6 for ages 12 and younger, seniors and University of Louisville students. (502) 852-6664.

Friday: "BIG," 8 p.m.; "Laser Beatles," 9 p.m.; "Dynamic Earth," 10 p.m.; "Laser U2," 11 p.m.

Saturday:

"Perfect Little Planet," 1 p.m.; "Laser Magic," 2 p.m.; "Black Holes: The Other Side of Infinity," 3 p.m.

Cruise

Belle of Louisville Dinner/Sightseeing Cruise. River Road, 7-9 p.m. Thursday and Friday. $43, $42 seniors, $27 children. Sightseeing only, $21, $20 seniors, $12 children. (502) 574-2992.

Belle of Louisville Lunch/Sightseeing Cruise. River Road, noon-2 p.m. Friday and Saturday. $35, $34 seniors, $25 children. Sightseeing only, $21, $20 seniors, $12 children. (502) 574-2992.

Spirit of Jefferson Harbor Cruise. River Road, 3-4 p.m. Saturday. $15, $9 children. (502) 574-2992.

Spirit of Jefferson Dinner/Sightseeing Cruise. River Road, 7-9 p.m. Saturday and Tuesday. $43, $42 seniors, $27 children. Sightseeing only, $21, $20 seniors, $12 children. (502) 574-2992.

Spirit of Jefferson Lunch/Sightseeing Cruise. Fourth and River Road, noon-2 p.m. July 16. $35, $34 seniors, $25 children. Sightseeing only, $21, $20 seniors, $12 children. (502) 574-2992.

Dances

Nuts N Honeys Dance Club. Dance Louisville, 8023 Catherine Lane, 7-11 p.m. Friday. Beginner and intermediate line dancing and couples dancing. $5. (502) 643-2786 or bigalofamerica@aol.com.

Singles Dance. Moose Lodge, 4615 Fegenbush Lane, 7:30-11 p.m. Sunday. Music by Kenny Sauter's Masters of Music DJ Service. Door prizes. $6 before 8 p.m.; $7 after 8. (502) 736-7600.

Exhibits

21c Museum Hotel. 700 W. Main St. "Transporting Transformation: Cuba, In and Out," by Jose Toirac, Sandra Ramos and others; "Chito Yoshida: Love for Sale," by Chito Yoshida; "A Thirsty Switch Still Quivers For Me," by Gina Phillips. "Burnouts," by Julia Christensen. All end April 2015. (502) 217-6300.

Actors Theatre of Louisville Gallery. 316 W. Main St. "Kentucky Watercolor Society: Aqueous USA 2014," 37th annual juried exhibition. Ends Dec. 23.

The Arts Council of Southern Indiana. 825 E. Market St. "The Party in My Head," by Kent Epler. Ends Jan. 10.

Asia Institute Crane House. 1244 S. Third St. "Poking the Lillies Pad," ceramic works by nationally recognized, emerging Asian American artists. Ends March 15.

Bridge Gallery. Mellwood Art Center, 1860 Mellwood Ave. "Seasons," by Carol Labashosky. Ends Dec. 15.

Carnegie Center for Art & History. 201 E. Spring St., New Albany. "Earth-Tones: Art Quilts," by Penny Sisto. Ends Jan. 10.

Conrad-Caldwell House Museum. 1402 St. James Court. "Louisville's River." Ends May 31, 2015.

Craft(s) Gallery. 572 S. Fourth St. "la Vida, la Muerte y el Amor" (Life, Death and Love), new works by Sarah and Jeral Tidwell. Ends Nov. 21.

Filson Historical Society. 1310 S. Third St. "Steamboating on Western Waters." Ends Dec. 30. (502) 635-5083.

Flame Run Gallery. 815 W. Market St. Works by Steven Ciezki. Ends Nov. 22.

Frazier History Museum. 829 W. Main St. "Lifestyles of the Rich & Famous: Art, Fashion & Luxury During the Gilded Age." Ends Feb. 1. Opening Saturday, "Irving Berlin's White Christmas: The Exhibit." Ends Jan. 11.

Galerie Hertz. 1253 S. Preston St. "Light Sculptures," by Rich Griendling. Ends Sunday.

The Gallery at Mann and Fox. Professional Towers, 401 Dupont Circle, Suite 505. "The Art of Embroidery," by Bette Levy. Ends Dec. 31.

Garner Narrative Contemporary Fine Art. 642 E. Market St. "Deconstructing Melancholy," by Aleksandra Stone. Ends Nov. 28.

The Green Building. 732 E. Market St. "Incommunicado," a three-dimensional exhibit by Amy Chase, Patrick Donley and Brad White. Ends Nov. 28.

Heart Gallery. 902 E. Washington St. "Core Constellation," by Amy Stephens McClain. Ends Nov. 28.

Horseshoe Gallery. Horseshoe Casino, 11999 Casino Center Drive, Elizabeth, Ind. "Delectable." Ends Dec. 31.

Huff Gallery. Spalding University, 853 Library Lane. "Ligne Rouge." Ends Dec. 19.

Indiana University Southeast Barr Gallery. 4201 Grant Line Road. "The Life of Brian: A 36 Year View," by Brian H. Jones. Ends Nov. 21.

Jeffersontown Historical Museum. 10635 Watterson Trail. Historic photos and artifacts. Ends Dec. 19.

Kaviar Forge & Gallery. 1718 Frankfort Ave. "Abstract in Kentucky." Ends Jan. 3.

Kentucky Derby Museum. 704 Central Ave. "Horse Play," highlighting the playful side of the Kentucky Derby and featuring historical equine toys, digital interactives and music created for the museum. Ends Dec. 31. (502) 637-1111.

Kentucky Science Center. 727 W. Main St. "The World We Create." Permanent exhibit that explores science, technology, engineering and math (STEM) through collaborative and open-ended challenges.

Kentucky Watercolor Society Gallery. 4836 Brownsboro Road. "Celebrating the Season in Watercolor." Reception Friday, 5:30-7:30 p.m. Ends Jan. 31.

Kore Gallery. 1860 Mellwood Ave. Works by Thom Eckert. Ends Nov. 26.

Local Speed. 822 E. Market St. "Remix: Stephen Paul Day, Sibylle Peretti, The Leight Collection." Ends Feb. 21.

Louisville Free Public Library. 301 York St. "Black Freedom, White Allies and Red Scare: Louisville, 1954." Ends Nov. 29.

Metro Hall. 527 W. Jefferson St. "Infinite Perspectives," by Ann Stewart Anderson, Ashley Brossart and Dhamin Jassim. Ends Jan. 16.

Paul Paletti Gallery. 713 E. Market St. "Small Worlds," photographs by Margaret Oechsli. Ends Dec. 29.

Peyton Samuel Head Family Museum. Oldham County History Center, 106 N. Second St., La Grange. "I Pledge Allegiance: Honoring Our World War II Veterans." Ends March 22, 2015.

Portland Museum. 2308 Portland Ave. Works by Julius Friedman. Ends Dec. 23.

Pyro Gallery. 909 E. Market St. "Collected Materials + Familiar Things," by Kim Huber. Ends Saturday.

Swanson Contemporary. 638 E. Market St. "19+1 A Collaboration," by Joel Feldman, students of Common Good and Lexington Art League. Ends Saturday.

Wayside Expressions Gallery. Wayside Christian Mission, 120 W. Broadway. "Colors," by Creative Diversity Studios. Ends Dec. 2.

Zephyr Gallery. 610 E. Market St. "Project 5: Stranger Than Function." Ends Dec. 20.

Other attractions

Lazer Blaze. 4121 Shelbyville Road, Friday, 4 p.m.-midnight; Saturday, 10 a.m.-midnight; Sunday, noon-9 p.m.; Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, 4-9 p.m. Laser tag, laser tag museum, arcade, cafe. $7 per game, $12 for two games. (502) 895-2985.

Robben's Roost. 5906 Six Mile Lane, Friday, 7-11 p.m.; Saturday, 1-4 and 7:30-10:30 p.m.; Sunday, 1-4 p.m.; Tuesday and Thursday, 11 a.m.-1 p.m. Roller skating. Fridays, $6; Saturday afternoons, $4, evenings, $5; Sundays, $4; Tuesdays and Thursdays, $3. (502) 491-8170.

Skate World. 6310 Preston Highway, 7-11 p.m. Fridays; 1-4 and 7-11 p.m. Saturdays; 1-4 p.m. Sundays, Tuesdays and Thursdays. Roller skating. Friday and Saturday evenings, $5; Saturday and Sunday afternoons, $4; Tuesdays and Thursdays, $3. (502) 969-6000.

Wheel Fun Rentals. Waterfront Park. 10 a.m.-7 p.m. Saturday and Sunday. Bike rentals: cruisers, tandems, choppers, quad sports, deuce coupes, four-wheel surrey bikes. Group rates available. www.wheelfunrentals.com.

Open Range Sports. 6401 Cross Keys Blvd., Crestwood, 4-8 p.m. Friday; 11 a.m.-8 p.m. Saturday; noon-5 p.m. Sunday. Indoor paintball/reball and a gun range. (502) 243-8282; www.openrangesports.com.
